definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: This is probably the result of long and boring office hours, when nothing interesting happens.
sentences.chinese: 這可能是漫長無聊刻板的辦公時間導致的。

sentences.english: Stereotyped behavior is not adapted to the exigencies of individual problems.
sentences.chinese: 刻板的行爲無法適應於具體問題。

sentences.english: The policy of the annually balanced budget represents a rigid straightjacket.
sentences.chinese: 年度平衡預算的政策是一種刻板的束縛。
第二層就是私下刻板印象。

sentences.english: I think it's a true stereotype but it's a stereotype nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 這是正確的，但它還是刻板印象。

sentences.english: The relations have rigidified into fixed patterns.
sentences.chinese: 這種關係已刻板不變成爲固定形式。

sentences.english: And inflexible and sensitive Chen Xiaozheng chose to go abroad again when graduate however study abroad.
sentences.chinese: 而刻板敏感的陳孝正卻在畢業之際又選擇了出國留學。

sentences.english: Stereotypes have all sorts of effects.
sentences.chinese: 刻板印象會產生各種各樣的作用。

sentences.english: But like striking modernist architecture, there's real elegance in that starkness .
sentences.chinese: 就像是著名的現代建築，有真正的優雅在這刻板裏。

sentences.english: It's an acceptable stereotype to make a generalization from.
sentences.chinese: 人們可以接受用這個刻板印象來以一概全。

sentences.english: One thing this company has never been is stuffy.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司從椰棕牀墊價格不曾刻板而無趣。

sentences.english: My life as a recruit was regimented.
sentences.chinese: 我的新兵生活極其刻板。
這是一種錯誤的刻板印象。

sentences.english: She rebelled against the regimentation of school life.
sentences.chinese: 她曾反抗刻板的學校生活。

sentences.english: IAT is a effective tool for measuring occupation-sex stereotype.
sentences.chinese: IAT是測量職業性別刻板印象的有效工具。

sentences.english: The Ministry of Education currently has rigid requirements on curriculum and personnel management.
sentences.chinese: 教育部對課程和人事管理要求刻板。

definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
